metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12536 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In Eclipse Jetty Server, all 9.x versions, on webapps deployed using default Error Handling, when an intentionally bad query arrives that doesn't match a dynamic url-pattern, and is eventually handled by the DefaultServlet's static file serving, the bad characters can trigger a java.nio.file.InvalidPathException which includes the full path to the base resource directory that the DefaultServlet and/or webapp is using. If this InvalidPathException is then handled by the default Error Handler, the InvalidPathException message is included in the error response, revealing the full server path to the requesting system.

criterions.comment: jetty9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
